title: Microsoft Windows EFI Partition Incorrect Authorization Denial-of-Service Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to create a denial-of-service condition on affected installations of Microsoft Windows. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the Windows kernel. The issue results from improper authorization logic when accessing files in the EFI partition. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to create a denial-of-service condition on the system.
addtionnal_details: Microsoft has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2022-21899
timeline:
2021-10-01 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2022-01-13 - Coordinated public release of advisory
